item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

summary.text: Authorizes appropriations for grants under the Victims of Child Abuse Act of 1990 for technical assistance and training programs for FY 2006 through 2010 to the American Prosecutors Research Institute's National Center for Prosecution of Child Abuse and the Institute's National Child Protection Training Center at Winona State University.

bill.title: A bill to authorize funding for the American Prosecutors Research Institute's National Center for Prosecution of Child Abuse and the American Prosecutors Research Institute's National Child Protection Training Center at Winona State University.

item.title: A bill to authorize funding for the American Prosecutors Research Institute's National Center for Prosecution of Child Abuse and the American Prosecutors Research Institute's National Child Protection Training Center at Winona State University.

A bill to authorize funding for the American Prosecutors Research Institute's National Center for Prosecution of Child Abuse and the American Prosecutors Research Institute's National Child Protection Training Center at Winona State University.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
